  physical_appearance: This is a decorative hair comb. The teeth of the comb is made of metal. The comb is topped with a gold decorative head
 with floral and foliage motifs. The comb is also adorned with pearl beads.

  subject_terms_1: exports hair ornaments cultural diffusion flower (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Exports Motifs Hair ornaments Culture diffusion Ornamental combs

  subject_terms_3: Ethnic costume

  sgcool_label_text: Peineta are decorative hair combs which first became popular in the Philippines. Based on original Spanish as well as Chinese designs such combs were produced in Manila for local consumption as well as for export. Today old examples can be found all over Southeast Asia. Such combs went out of fashion when shorter hair styles came into vogue in the 20th century.
